In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, chopped basil, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each tomato with the breadcrumb mixture.
Drizzle olive oil over the stuffed tomatoes.
Place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender and the topping is golden brown.
Serve hot as baked tomatoes.
In a mixing bowl, combine grated cheese, finely chopped onions, finely chopped green chilies, chopped fresh coriander leaves, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to make a cheese mixture.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Cut into squares or desired shapes and serve as cheese squares.
In a mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, boiled green peas, breadcrumbs, finely chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into tikkis or patties.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot as chatpati tikki.
In a bowl, combine lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Marinate the fish fillets in this mixture for 30 minutes.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the marinated fish fillets for 4-5 minutes on each side or until they are cooked through and have grill marks.
Garnish with lemon wedges and serve hot as grilled lemon fish.
In a pan, heat a little oil and sauté the finely chopped mushrooms until they release their moisture and become dry.
In a mixing bowl, combine sautéed mushrooms, boiled and mashed potatoes, grated paneer, finely chopped green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into kababs or patties.
Coat the kababs with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the kababs until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot as mushroom shammi kababs.
In a mixing bowl, combine papadi, boiled and chopped potatoes, boiled chickpeas, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, and chopped fresh coriander leaves.
Add sweet tamarind chutney, red chili powder, chaat masala, and cumin powder. Mix well.
Garnish with yogurt and sev.
Serve immediately as Punjabi papadi chaat.
In a mixing bowl, combine chopped spinach leaves, gram flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add enough water to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the spinach batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot as spinach pakodas.
Grind soaked urad dal into a smooth paste using a little water.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the urad dal batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Dip the fried bhallas in warm water for a few minutes to soften them.
Squeeze out excess water and arrange the bhallas in a serving dish.
Whisk yogurt with a little salt and spread it over the bhallas.
Drizzle sweet tamarind chutney and green chutney over the yogurt.
Sprinkle cumin powder and red chili powder on top.
Serve chilled as stuffed dahi bhallas.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, onions, tomatoes), cubed
methods: In a pan, heat a little oil and sauté mixed vegetables until they are slightly cooked.
Add cubed paneer and sauté for a few minutes until paneer turns golden brown.
In a bowl, whisk yogurt with cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Pour the yogurt mixture over the sautéed vegetables and paneer.
Stir well and cook for a few more minutes until everything is well coated and heated through.
Serve hot as vegetable & paneer delight.
Wash and rinse all the dals together.
Pressure cook the dals with turmeric powder and enough water until they are soft and mushy.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chili. Sauté for a minute.
Add asafoetida and sauté briefly.
Pour this tempering over the cooked dal. Add salt and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve Panchmel Daliche Varan hot with rice or roti.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, besan, turmeric powder, and water to make a smooth mixture.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and stir continuously on medium heat.
Let it simmer until the kadhi thickens and comes to a boil. Add salt and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Maharashtrian Kadhi hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add grated ginger, chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil separates.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed, to reach the desired consistency.
Serve Dhabey Di Dal hot with rice or naan.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add grated ginger, chopped tomato, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the soaked and drained lobia. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Add enough water to cover the lobia, and simmer until they are cooked and the gravy thickens.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Lobia hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomato, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed, to reach the desired consistency.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Wateli Dal hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1 cup black gram dal (urad dal), soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add chopped tomato, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Dal Maharani hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Rajasthani Dal hot with roti or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup whole urad dal (black gram), soaked
1/4 cup black gram dal (urad dal), split and soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Punj Rattani Dal hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the chopped okra and cluster beans. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the cooked dal and simmer for a few more minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Bheendi Gavar Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the chana dal.
Pressure cook the chana dal with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Gram Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the chana dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Katachi Aamti hot with rice or roti.
Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, asafoetida, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add cooked toor dal, black pepper powder, and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Tomato Rasam hot as a soup or with rice.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, besan, turmeric powder, and water to make a smooth mixture.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and stir continuously on medium heat.
Let it simmer until the kadhi thickens and comes to a boil. Add salt and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Gujarati Kadhi hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (Bengal gram dal), soaked
methods: Wash and rinse the chana dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Cholar Dal/Bengal Gram Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the toor dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked toor dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Yellow Dal Fry hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the masoor dal.
Pressure cook the masoor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the chopped spinach and cook until it wilts.
Add the cooked masoor dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Palak Masoor Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the masoor dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add cream, red chili powder, and salt. Simmer for a few minutes.
Add the cooked masoor dal and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Dal Pakhtooni hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup black gram dal (urad dal), soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Dal Makhani hot with naan or rice.
Pressure cook the soaked kidney beans until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked kidney beans and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Rajmah Rasmisa hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumsticks, etc.), chopped
methods: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft and mushy.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Add tamarind paste, sambhar powder, and salt. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add the cooked toor dal and simmer for a few more minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Sambhar hot with rice or idli.
Wash and rinse the rice and sprouted moong together.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add rice and sprouted moong, turmeric powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add garam masala and water. Cook until the khichdi is soft and well-cooked.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Sprouted Moong Khichdi hot.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, asafoetida, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the dals turn golden brown.
Add tamarind paste and puliyodharai powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Mix the tamarind mixture with the cooked rice, add salt, and mix well.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Puliyodharai.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Sauté for a few more minutes.
Mix the tempering with the cooked rice and toss well.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Fodnicha Bhaat.
Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add carrots and green peas, turmeric powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Carrot & Pea Pulao.
Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until they turn soft.
Add soya granules, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Tomato Soya Pulao.

ingredients: 1/2 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse the rice and split green gram dal together.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add onion rings and sauté until they turn golden brown.

Add the washed rice and dal mixture and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add fresh methi leaves and corn kernels. Sauté until the methi leaves wilt.
Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Methi Corn Pulao.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.
In a microwave-safe bowl, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, asafoetida, curry leaves, and green chilies. Microwave for a minute or until the dals turn golden brown.
Add grated coconut and microwave for another minute.
Mix the tempering with the cooked rice, add salt, and toss well.
Serve Microwave Coconut Rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas), chopped
methods: Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add mixed vegetables, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add peas, paneer cubes, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.

Divide the rice into three equal portions. In one portion, add grated carrots, in another portion, add peas, and in the third portion, add grated beetroot. Sauté each portion with turmeric powder and salt separately.
Layer the three colored rice portions in a serving dish.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Tri Colour Rice.

ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed dry fruits (cashews, almonds, raisins)
A pinch of saffron strands soaked in warm milk
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
Boil the rice with enough water and a pinch of salt until it's 70% cooked. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat ghee, add mixed dry fruits and sauté until they turn golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add sugar and a little water. Cook until sugar syrup is formed.
Add the cooked rice, saffron milk, cardamom powder, and orange food color (if using). Mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and the flavors are well blended.
Garnish with sautéed dry fruits and serve Zarda hot.

In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon stick, and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add cashews and raisins. Sauté until cashews turn golden brown.
Add pineapple chunks and sauté for a few minutes.
Add the drained rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, salt, and cover to cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Add the drained rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, salt, and cover to cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Add the drained rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, salt, and cover to cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

Add the drained rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, salt, and cover to cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.

methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.

In a pot, add rice, water, and a pinch of salt. Bring it to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas), chopped
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.

ingredients: 1/2 cup chicken pieces (or meat of your choice)
A few saffron strands soaked in warm milk
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and thinly sliced onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chicken pieces and sauté until they turn brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add yogurt and garam masala. Mix well and cook until the chicken is tender.
In a separate pot, cook the drained rice with enough water until it's 70% cooked. Drain.
Layer the cooked chicken mixture and partially cooked rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, alternating layers.
Sprinkle saffron milk on top and cover the pot. Cook on low heat until the biriyani is fully cooked and flavors are well blended.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Serve Nawabi Biriyani hot.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (potatoes, carrots, peas), chopped
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.

Add the mint paste and sauté until it releases its aroma.
Add the drained rice and sauté for another few minutes.

In a pressure cooker, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Sauté until they crackle.

Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and bay leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add drained rice and sauté for a few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Jeera Rice.

ingredients: A few saffron strands soaked in warm milk
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and sauté for a minute.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add cleaned prawns and sauté until they turn pink and opaque.
Add drained rice, salt, and mix well.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is 70% cooked. Drain.
Layer the partially cooked rice and prawns mixture in a heavy-bottomed pot, alternating layers.
Sprinkle yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix gently.
Pour saffron milk on top and cover the pot. Cook on low heat until the pulao is fully cooked and flavors are well blended.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Serve Prawn Pulao hot.

ingredients: A few saffron strands soaked in warm milk
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and thinly sliced onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chicken pieces and sauté until they are browned.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and pulpy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add yogurt and garam masala. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes.
In a separate pot, cook the drained rice with enough water until it's 70% cooked. Drain.
Layer the cooked chicken mixture and partially cooked rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, alternating layers.
Sprinkle saffron milk on top and cover the pot. Cook on low heat until the biriyani is fully cooked and flavors are well blended.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Serve Chicken Biriyani hot.

A few saffron strands soaked in warm milk
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
methods: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and thinly sliced onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add yogurt and garam masala. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes.
In a separate pot, cook the drained rice with enough water until it's 70% cooked. Drain.
Layer the cooked vegetable mixture and partially cooked rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, alternating layers.

Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Serve Vegetable Biriyani hot.
Mash the cooked rice and allow it to cool.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and dried red chilies. Sauté until dals turn golden brown.
Add asafoetida, curry leaves, roasted peanuts, and grated coconut. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add mashed rice, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well.
Serve Lemon Rice.
Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, cloves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and sauté for a minute.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, corn)
methods: Heat oil in a pot, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add mixed vegetables, shredded cabbage, turmeric powder, garam masala, and black pepper powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the vegetables are tender.
Season with salt, garnish with cilantro, and serve Celestial Vegetable Soup.
Cook toor dal until soft and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, dry red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, tamarind paste, and cooked toor dal. Mix well.
Add water and let it simmer for a few minutes.
Season with salt, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve Tomato Rasam.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute.
Add dry red chilies and curry leaves. Sauté for another minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, and sugar. Cook until tomatoes become soft and mushy.
Add grated coconut and cook for a few more minutes.
Allow the mixture to cool, then blend it into a smooth paste.
Transfer the paste back to the pan, add water to reach your desired consistency, and bring it to a boil.
Season with salt, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve Tomato Saar.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Add tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.
Add green peas, turmeric powder, garam masala, and black pepper powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the peas are tender.
Season with salt, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve Matar Ka Shorba.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Add shredded cabbage and sauté for a few minutes.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, and black pepper powder. Cook until tomatoes become soft.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the cabbage is tender.
Season with salt, garnish with cilantro, and serve Tomato Cabbage Soup.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Divide the sautéed onions into three parts.
In one part, add carrots, in another part add peas, and in the third part add sweet corn kernels.
Sauté each part separately with turmeric powder and black pepper powder until vegetables are tender.
Blend each sautéed mixture into a smooth paste separately.
In a serving bowl, pour the vegetable broth. Add one color of the blended paste and mix well.
Repeat with the other two colors. Serve Tri Colour Soup garnished with coriander leaves.
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine mushrooms, almonds, chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies.
Microwave on high for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until mushrooms and onions are tender.
Transfer the mixture to a blender, add cumin seeds, black pepper powder, and turmeric powder. Blend into a smooth paste.
Transfer the paste to a pot, add vegetable broth, and bring to a boil.
Simmer for a few minutes, season with salt, and garnish with chopped parsley before serving Microwave Mushroom & Almond Soup.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Add diced pumpkin, turmeric powder, and black pepper powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the pumpkin is tender.
Blend the soup into a smooth puree using a blender.
Season with salt, garnish with chopped chives, and serve Pumpkin Soup.

ingredients: 2 cups crab meat, cleaned and chopped
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Add crab meat, turmeric powder, and black pepper powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the fish or seafood broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the crab meat is cooked.
Season with salt, garnish with chopped parsley, and serve Crab Soup.
In a large pot, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn golden brown.
Add mutton trotters, turmeric powder, and black pepper powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the water, cover the pot, and simmer for several hours until the trotters are tender and the broth is flavorful.
Season with salt, garnish with chopped coriander leaves, and serve Mutton Paya hot.
In a pot, melt butter and sauté onions and garlic until translucent.
Add diced potatoes and cook for a few minutes.
Add fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Blend the soup until smooth, then return it to the pot.
Stir in heavy cream and heat through. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with grated Parmesan cheese and serve Cream of Spinach Soup.
In a pot, melt butter and add baby onions. Sauté until they start to brown.
Pour in vegetable broth and add thyme. Simmer until onions are tender.
Blend half of the soup until smooth and return it to the pot.
Stir in milk, heat through, and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Baby Onion Soup.
In a pot, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add mutton cubes and sear until browned on all sides.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for a few minutes.
Add diced potatoes and sliced carrots. Cook for another few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until mutton is tender and the stew thickens.
Stir in coconut milk, heat through, and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve Mutton Stew.

ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
methods: In a pot, melt butter and sauté onions and garlic until translucent.
Add diced potatoes and corn kernels. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Blend half of the soup until smooth and return it to the pot.
Stir in heavy cream, heat through, and season with salt and white pepper.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve Cream of Corn Soup.

Add minced garlic, chopped onions, and diced carrots. Sauté until onions turn translucent.

Garnish with toasted pumpkin seeds and serve Red Pumpkin Soup.
In a pot, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, sugar, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until tomatoes are fully cooked.
Blend the soup until smooth and return it to the pot.
Stir in milk, diced paneer, and black pepper powder. Heat through.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Tomato & Paneer Soup.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, corn)
methods: In a pot, melt butter and sauté chopped onions and minced garlic until translucent.
Add diced potatoes and mixed vegetables. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Blend half of the soup until smooth and return it to the pot.
Stir in milk, heat through, and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Soup with Vegetables.

Add minced garlic and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.

Remove from heat and stir in yogurt. Reheat gently, without boiling.

Add cumin seeds, black pepper powder, mint leaves, and salt. Blend again.
Chill the soup in the refrigerator for at least an hour.
Serve Ice Cucumber Soup in bowls with ice cubes for a refreshing touch.

Add diced potatoes and sliced mushrooms. Sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Blend half of the soup until smooth and return it to the pot.
Stir in milk, heat through, and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped fresh thyme and serve Fresh Mushroom Soup.

ingredients: 1/2 cup bell peppers (red and green), chopped
methods: In a blender, combine tomatoes, cucumber, bell peppers, and onions. Blend until smooth.
In a pot, heat a little oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add the blended mixture to the pot and cook for a few minutes.
Stir in tomato ketchup, cumin powder, paprika, and black pepper powder.
Pour in chicken broth and simmer until flavors meld together.
Remove from heat, let it cool, and chill in the refrigerator.
Stir in yogurt and shredded chicken before serving Cold Chicken Tomato Soup.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Stir in coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer until they absorb the flavors.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Peshawari Chana.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), finely chopped
methods: For Koftas:
In a bowl, combine grated paneer, mashed potatoes, chopped mixed vegetables, corn flour, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well and shape the mixture into small balls.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the paneer and vegetable balls until golden brown. Drain and set aside.
For Gravy:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add tomato puree and cashew paste. Cook until the oil separates from the mixture.
Stir in cream and season with salt.
Place the fried koftas in the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Malai Kofta.
In a bowl, whisk yogurt and besan together to make a smooth paste.
In a pot, heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn golden brown.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and chopped green chilies. Cook for a few minutes.
Pour in the yogurt and besan mixture, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Add water and salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Punjabi Kadhi.

ingredients: 1/2 cup bell peppers (red and green), diced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.
Add diced bell peppers and sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cubed paneer and simmer until it absorbs the flavors.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Kadhai Paneer.
Blanch the whole cauliflower in hot water for a few minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.

Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.

Cover and simmer until the cauliflower is tender and absorbs the flavors.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Gobhi Mussalam.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.

Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Aloo Dumwale.

In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter.

Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.

Place the stuffed brinjals in the pan, cover, and cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Stuffed Baingan.
Blanch the spinach leaves in hot water, then blend them into a fine puree.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add the spinach puree and cook for a few minutes.
Add the paneer cubes and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cream and serve Palak Paneer.
Roast the eggplants over an open flame or in an oven until the skin is charred and they become soft.
Peel the charred skin and mash the roasted eggplant flesh.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the mashed eggplant and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Baingan Bharta.
Wash and dry the okra. Slit them lengthwise without cutting them into two pieces.
In a bowl, mix besan, cumin seeds, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.
Stuff the besan mixture into the slits of the okra.
In a pan, heat oil and add the stuffed okra. Cook until they are tender and crispy.
Serve Stuffed Bhindi hot.
Blanch the spinach leaves in hot water, then blend them into a fine puree.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add the diced potatoes and spinach puree. Cook until the potatoes are tender.
Serve Palak Aloo hot.

ingredients: 250 grams paneer (cottage cheese), sliced into thick pieces
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground into a paste
methods: In a bowl, mix yogurt, cashew paste, tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add the yogurt-cashew-tomato mixture and cook until the oil separates.
Add the sliced paneer pieces and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Paneer Pasanda.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), boiled
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground into a paste
methods: In a bowl, mix cashew paste, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add the cashew-yogurt mixture and cook until the oil separates.
Add the boiled mixed vegetables and paneer cubes. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Navaratan Korma.
Wash the eggplants and slit them in a plus (+) shape without separating the segments.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the yogurt and cook until the eggplants are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Dahi Baingan.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled and diced potatoes and cook for a few minutes.
Add yogurt and simmer until the potatoes are coated with the gravy.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Moglai Potatoes.
Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the pulp to create hollow shells.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add crumbled paneer and mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes.
Stuff the tomato shells with the paneer-potato mixture.
Bake or cook the stuffed tomatoes until they are tender.
Serve Stuffed Tomatoes hot.

ingredients: Lemon wedges and mint leaves for garnish
methods: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tandoori masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.
Coat the cauliflower florets with the yogurt-spice mixture and marinate for at least an hour.
Preheat the oven or grill to high heat.
Thread the marinated cauliflower onto skewers and grill or bake until they are charred and cooked through.
Garnish with lemon wedges and mint leaves and serve Tandoori Gobi.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cauliflower florets and green peas. Cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Cauliflower Peas Curry.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed bitter vegetables (e.g., bitter gourd, bitter melon), sliced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the mixed bitter vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Mixed Bitter Vegetable Curry.
Grind the poppy seeds into a fine paste with some water.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and the poppy seed paste. Sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled and diced potatoes and cook until they are coated with the poppy seed mixture.
Add yogurt and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Potatoes in Poppy Seeds.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), boiled
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground into a paste
methods: In a bowl, mix cashew paste, tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add the cashew-tomato mixture and cook until the oil separates.
Add the boiled mixed vegetables and paneer cubes. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Shahi Curry.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., potatoes, carrots, bell peppers), diced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the diced mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 20-25 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Baked Vegetable Potpourri.
In a bowl, mix gram flour, yogurt, and tamarind pulp to make a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add diced potatoes, sliced carrots, and drumstick pieces. Cook for a few minutes.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the gram flour-yogurt-tamarind paste and cook until the vegetables are tender and the kadhi thickens.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Sindhi Kadhi.

ingredients: 1/2 cup sesame seeds, roasted and ground
methods: Slit the green chilies lengthwise without cutting them into two pieces.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and fenugreek seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and the slit green chilies. Cook for a few minutes.
Stir in roasted and ground peanuts, roasted and ground sesame seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add tamarind pulp and enough water to make a thick sauce. Simmer until the chilies are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Mirchi ka Salan.
Clean and chop the mustard greens and spinach.
In a large pot, blanch the greens in boiling water for a few minutes, then drain and blend them into a coarse puree.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the maize flour (makki ka atta) and sauté for a few minutes.
Add the blended greens and cook until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Sarso ka Saag.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled and diced potatoes and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Amritsari Aloo.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped fenugreek leaves (methi) and sweet corn kernels. Cook until the methi wilts and the corn is tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cream and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Methi Corn Malai.
Wash the brinjals and slit them in a plus (+) shape without separating the segments.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Stuff the roasted and ground peanuts mixture into the slits of the brinjals.
Place the stuffed brinjals in the pan, cover, and cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Bharli Waangi.

ingredients: 2 cups colocasia leaves (arbi ke patte), chopped
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped colocasia leaves and sauté until they wilt.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add roasted gram flour (besan) and grated coconut. Cook for a few minutes.
Serve Aluchi Bhaji hot.
Wash the split yellow lentils (moong dal) and cook them in water until soft.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped spinach (palak) and cooked moong dal. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Dal Palak.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the paneer cubes and bell pepper strips. Cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Paneer Capsicum.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the paneer cubes and green peas. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Matar Paneer.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled chickpeas (chole) and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Chole.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumsticks, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat coconut oil and add cumin seeds and green chilies.
Add diced mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in turmeric powder, curry leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Add yogurt and grated coconut. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Serve Avial hot.

ingredients: 1 cup colocasia leaves (arbi ke patte), chopped
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped colocasia leaves and sauté until they wilt.
Stir in turmeric powder and salt. Mix well.
Add roasted gram flour (besan) and grated coconut. Cook for a few minutes.
Serve Sourac hot.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), boiled
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Stir in cashew nut paste and cook until the oil separates.
Add boiled mixed vegetables and cream. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Malai Korma.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., potatoes, yam, brinjal, peas), diced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add diced mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add grated coconut and roasted gram flour (besan). Cook for a few minutes.
Serve Undhiyo hot.
For Gatte:
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, cumin seeds, red chili powder, asafoetida, salt, yogurt, and oil.
Knead the mixture into a stiff dough. Add water as needed.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into cylindrical dumplings (gatte).
Boil the gatte in water until they float to the surface. Drain and set aside.
For Gravy:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled gatte to the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Gatte Ki Sabzi.
In a bowl, mix turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Coat the eggplant slices with the spice mixture.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the eggplant slices until they are cooked and golden brown on both sides.
Serve Begun Bhaja hot.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets. Cook until they are tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Alupulkofi.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (potatoes, pumpkin, eggplant, beans, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat mustard oil until it smokes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Add mustard seeds and turmeric powder to the oil and mix well.
Add diced mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in grated coconut, chopped green chilies, and salt. Mix well.
Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender and the coconut is fragrant.
Serve Labra hot.

ingredients: 500 grams arbi (taro root), boiled and peeled
methods: Heat ghee in a pan, add chopped onions, and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add boiled and peeled arbi (taro root) and cook for a few minutes.
Whisk together yogurt and cream and add it to the pan. Simmer until the arbi is coated with the creamy mixture.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Mughlai Arbi.
For Koftas:
In a bowl, combine mashed potatoes, grated paneer, corn flour, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into small round koftas and deep fry them in hot oil until they are golden brown. Drain and set aside.
For Curry:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add water to make the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
Add the fried koftas to the curry and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Kandhari Kofta Curry.

ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon saffron strands soaked in warm milk
methods: In a bowl, mix yogurt, saffron strands soaked in warm milk, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Coat the cauliflower florets with the yogurt mixture.
In a pan, heat ghee and sauté the cauliflower until it is cooked and golden brown.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Kesar Gobi.

ingredients: 500 grams arbi (taro root), boiled and peeled
methods: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add boiled and peeled arbi (taro root) and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Arbi Masala.
Wash the okra (bhindi) and slit them lengthwise without cutting them into two pieces.
In a bowl, mix roasted gram flour (besan), cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Stuff the okra with the gram flour mixture.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the stuffed okra until they are cooked and crispy.
Serve Bhindi Bharvan hot.
Clean and slice the lotus stem (nadur) and blanch it in boiling water until it is tender. Drain and set aside.
Blanch the spinach (palak) leaves in boiling water, then drain and blend them into a coarse puree.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the sliced lotus stem and spinach puree. Cook until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Nadur Palak.
In a pan, heat oil and butter, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cashew nut paste and cook until the oil separates.
Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese), cream, and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Paneer Butter Masala.
In a pan, heat oil and butter, add chopped onions, and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced mushrooms. Sauté until mushrooms are cooked and browned.
Stir in dried oregano, dried basil, red chili flakes, and salt. Mix well.
Add cream and half of the grated cheese. Mix until the cheese melts and the mixture thickens.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, top with the remaining grated cheese, and bake until golden brown and bubbly.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Mushroom & Cheese Bake.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese) and bell pepper strips. Cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Capsicum & Paneer Delight.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add green peas (matar) and cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Matar Lajawab.

recipes.recipe_name: Creamed Diced Carrots with Green Pepper
patterns: Creamed Diced Carrots with Green Pepper
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
methods: In a pan, melt butter and add diced carrots. Sauté for a few minutes until they start to soften.
Add diced green bell pepper and continue to sauté until both the carrots and bell pepper are tender.
Stir in heavy cream, milk, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Simmer until the mixture thickens and is heated through.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Creamed Diced Carrots with Green Pepper.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add green peas (matar) and fresh fenugreek leaves (methi). Cook until they are tender.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Matar Methi Malai.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, beans, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.

ingredients: 1/2 cup moong dal (split green gram), soaked
methods: In a pressure cooker, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.

Add all the chopped greens (spinach, mustard greens, dill leaves, fenugreek leaves) and cook until they are tender.

Boil the potatoes until they are cooked but still firm. Allow them to cool, then peel and scoop out the centers to create a hollow cavity.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, and sauté for a minute.
Add grated paneer, mashed peas, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Stuff the potato cavities with the paneer and peas mixture.
In the same pan, place the stuffed potatoes and cook until they are browned and crispy on the outside.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Stuffed Potatoes.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.

Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Stir in ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.

Add sliced mushrooms and green peas (matar). Cook until they are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Matar Mushroom Masala.

Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese) and bell pepper strips. Cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Paneer Jalfrezi.

Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.

Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese) and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Cottage Cheese in Yellow Gravy.
Grind grated coconut, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, green chilies, and a little water to make a paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add turmeric powder and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute.
Add pineapple chunks and cook until they are soft.
Stir in the coconut paste and cook for a few minutes.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Then, mix in yogurt and salt.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve Pineapple Pachadi.

Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese), cream, and simmer for a few minutes.

Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese) and green peas (matar). Cook for a few minutes.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Paneer Matar Masala.

Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cashew nut paste and cook until the oil separates.
Add cubed paneer (cottage cheese), cream, and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Shahi Paneer.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat butter, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cashew nut paste and cook until the oil separates.
Add diced mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Veg Makhanwala.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cauliflower florets and cook until they are tender.
Stir in yogurt and cashew nut paste. Simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Gobhi Korma.
In a pan, heat mustard oil until it smokes, then let it cool slightly.
Add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add diced potatoes and pointed gourds. Cook until they are tender.
Grind grated coconut with a little water to make a paste and add it to the pan.
Simmer for a few more minutes, garnish with chopped fresh coriander, and serve Alu Potal Rasa.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, tomatoes, etc.)
methods: Cut the tops off the mixed vegetables and hollow them out.
